alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:48PM EST until December 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River Near Wilmington affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River near Wilmington. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding will affect low lying neighborhoods from Wilmington through Tewksbury to Lawrence. This includes a portion of Route 114 in Lawrence. Areas subject to basement flooding should move valuables to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 7.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.8 feet on 04/18/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1015 AM EST.
